alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Dickens; Floyd; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 25 at 9:11PM CDT until April 25 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Dickens County in northwestern Texas... Southeastern Floyd County in northwestern Texas... Northeastern Crosby County in northwestern Texas... Southwestern Motley County in northwestern Texas... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 910 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm with a history of producing large destructive hail was located near Dougherty, or 13 miles southeast of Floydada, moving southeast at 30 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR MCADOO...DICKENS...AFTON....AND SPUR. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. * Locations impacted include... Spur, Dickens, Dougherty, Afton, Mcadoo and Roaring Springs. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This is a dangerous storm! Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to shelter inside a strong building, and stay away from windows.
